Rival Sonic Solutions will take ownership of Roxio's consumer lines, which include the once market-leading Easy CD Creator, for \$80 million. To complete the identity change, Roxio will change its name to Napster.

title: Phelps, Thorpe Advance in 200 Freestyle (AP)
description: AP - Michael Phelps took care of qualifying for the Olympic 200-meter freestyle semifinals Sunday, and then found out he had been added to the American team for the evening's 400 freestyle relay final. Phelps' rivals Ian Thorpe and Pieter van den Hoogenband and teammate Klete Keller were faster than the teenager in the 200 free preliminaries.
title: Singh Takes Lead Into Final Round of PGA (AP)
description: AP - Whistling Straits is suddenly the least of anyone's worries. Even more daunting is Vijay Singh in control of his game and in the lead at the PGA Championship. When his 5-foot par putt disappeared into the cup on the final hole Saturday, Singh clenched his fist and raised his putter, the most valuable club in his bag. It took him 54 holes to get the lead all to himself, and it could not have come at a better time #151; or a better place.
title: Gasol Tops Yao in Marquee Matchup (AP)
description: AP - Pau Gasol and Spain won the Olympics' first matchup of NBA stars Sunday, easily beating Yao Ming and China. Gasol, who plays for the Memphis Grizzlies, had 21 points and 10 rebounds despite missing 6 minutes in the first quarter because of a bloody nose, and Spain won 83-58.
title: Boston's Schilling Picks Up Home Win (AP)
description: AP - David Ortiz's second homer of the game broke an eighth-inning tie, Curt Schilling got his first home win in seven weeks and the Boston Red Sox beat the Chicago White Sox 4-3 Saturday night.
title: Reds Knock Padres Out of Wild-Card Lead (AP)
description: AP - Wily Mo Pena homered twice and drove in four runs, helping the Cincinnati Reds beat the San Diego Padres 11-5 on Saturday night. San Diego was knocked out of a share of the NL wild-card lead with the loss and Chicago's victory over Los Angeles earlier in the day.
title: Lions Hold on for 27-21 Win Over Steelers (AP)
description: AP - It didn't take long for Joey Harrington to get reacquainted with Charles Rogers. Harrington completed passes to Rogers on three of Detroit's first seven plays and the Lions held on for a 27-21 victory over the Pittsburgh Steelers on Saturday night in the exhibition opener for both teams.
title: Dreaming done, NBA stars awaken to harsh Olympic reality (AFP)
description: AFP - National Basketball Association players trying to win a fourth consecutive Olympic gold medal for the United States have gotten the wake-up call that the "Dream Team" days are done even if supporters have not.
title: Indians Beat Twins 7-1, Nearing AL Lead (AP)
description: AP - The Cleveland Indians pulled within one game of the AL Central lead, scoring four runs in the first inning and beating the Minnesota Twins 7-1 Saturday night behind home runs by Travis Hafner and Victor Martinez.
title: Galaxy, Crew Play to 0-0 Tie (AP)
description: AP - Kevin Hartman made seven saves for Los Angeles, and Jon Busch had two saves for Columbus as the Galaxy and Crew played to a 0-0 tie Saturday night.
title: Coyotes Sign Langkow to 1-Year Contract (AP)
description: AP - The Phoenix Coyotes signed center Daymond Langkow to a one-year contract worth #36;2.95 million Saturday, just hours before a scheduled arbitration hearing.
title: USC Begins Season Where It Ended, at No. 1 (AP)
description: AP - Southern California will begin defense of its first national title in 31 years as the No. 1 team in the nation. The Trojans earned the top spot in the preseason Associated Press poll released Saturday by receiving 48 of 65 first-place votes and 1,603 points.
title: Italy's Pennetta Wins Idea Prokom Open (AP)
description: AP - Italy's Flavia Pennetta won the Idea Prokom Open for her first WTA Tour title, beating Klara Koukalova of the Czech Republic 7-5, 3-6, 6-3 Saturday after French Open champion Anastasia Myskina withdrew before the semifinals because of a rib injury.
title: Back Nine Drops Els Down Leaderboard (AP)
description: AP - The heartbreak might have begun a day early for Ernie Els. The runner-up at the Masters and the British Open, and in the final group at the U.S. Open before a closing-round meltdown, Els made the turn Saturday tied for the lead in the third round of the PGA Championship at Whistling Straits. But Els' short game abandoned him in a five-hole stretch that left him four shots behind leader Vijay Singh, three behind Justin Leonard and tied with four others in third place at 8 under.
title: Tough Race Ahead for Swimmer Phelps
description: ATHENS (Reuters) - Michael Phelps, his first gold medal safely gathered in, eased through the next phase of his monumental Olympic challenge in the heats of the 200 meters freestyle Sunday but the immensity of the task ahead was clear.
title: Iranian Will Not Meet Israeli in Olympics Due to Weight
description: ATHENS (Reuters) - A diplomatic wrangle of Olympic proportions was avoided Sunday when Iranian world judo champion Arash Miresmaeili failed to make the weight for his clash with an Israeli opponent.
title: Romanian Gymnasts Edge Ahead of U.S. Women
description: ATHENS (Reuters) - Daniela Sofronie displayed all her athleticism to edge Romania ahead of the United States in the Olympic women's gymnastics team qualifying on Sunday.

description: KOHLER, Wisconsin (Reuters) - Tiger Woods failed to make the most of a red-hot start in the U.S. PGA Championship third round on Saturday, having to settle for a three-under-par 69.

title: AL Wrap: Olerud Cheers Yankees by Sinking Ex-Team

description: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Chipper Jones cracked two homers and Julio Franco's two-run double in the seventh inning drove in the winning runs as the streaking Atlanta Braves downed the St. Louis Cardinals 9-7 in the National League Saturday.
title: Olympics-Doping-Greek Media Put Country's Honor Above Athletes
description: ATHENS (Reuters) - The honor of Greece lies above individual athletes and no backstage antics should compromise it, Greek media said Sunday, after the country's top athletes were suspended from the team under a cloud of doping suspicion.

description: ATHENS (Reuters) - The United States beat Canada in a world best time to qualify for the final of the men's Olympic eights race Sunday, as the two crews renewed their fierce rivalry in front of a raucous crowd at Schinias.
title: American Gymnasts Second to Romanians in Qualifying
description: ATHENS, Greece (AP) -- The U.S. gymnasts stumbled to the finish of their qualifying round Sunday and wound up second to Romania, trailing by more than a half-point. It's a good thing scores start over in Tuesday night's final, which looks to be a showdown between the Americans, the reigning world champions, and the Romanians, who won gold four years ago at the Sydney Games.

description: Even while they were rolling up an unprecedented 12 consecutive division championships, the brain trust behind Atlanta Braves had a hard time getting any respect.
title: Donovan Tallies Two
description: Landon Donovan scored both goals in the San Jose Earthquakes' 2-0 victory over the Kansas City Wizards on Saturday.
title: Statham Takes Lead
description: After only four days of practice, sophomore Joel Statham has widened his lead over Maryland's three other contenders for the starting quarterback job, Coach Ralph Friedgen said Saturday.
title: Schumacher Seizes Pole
description: Michael Schumacher won the pole Saturday for the Hungarian Grand Prix in Budapest with teammate Rubens Barrichello beside him.
title: True Sensation Wins A Wet One at Pimlico
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 14 -- Even before Hurricane Charley ranged up the East Coast and began to drop its drizzle on Pimlico Race Course, the \$75,000 All Brandy Stakes for Maryland-bred fillies and mares had been taken off the track's beat-up turf course.
title: Lynx Infielder Fontenot Has 'Pretty Good Pop for His Size'
description: At 5 feet 8, 160 pounds, second baseman Mike Fontenot looks more like the Class AAA Ottawa Lynx's batboy than one of the Baltimore Orioles' top prospects.
title: Texans Kick Cowboys
description: David Carr was 7 of 8 for 89 yards and a touchdown Saturday in the Houston Texans' 18-0 victory over the Dallas Cowboys in their preseason openers.
title: Australia, U.S. Set Record
description: The U.S. women's and men's eights team both set world bests in the Olympic rowing competition Sunday along with Australian pair Sally Newmarch and Amber Halliday.
title: Iranian Disqualified
description: A judo champion from Iran who said he would not compete against an Israeli athlete is disqualified from competition Sunday when he is found to be overweight.
title: Phelps On Relay Team
description: Michael Phelps is named to the 4x100-meter freestyle relay team that will compete in Sunday's final, keeping alive his quest for a possible eight Olympic gold medals.
title: V. Williams Wins Opening Match
description: Defending gold medalist Venus Williams overpowers Melinda Czink of Hungary 6-1, 6-2 in the opening match of the Athens Games' tennis tournament.
title: Floridians Return to Storm-Ravaged Homes (AP)
description: AP - After getting a first look at the widespread damage left behind by Hurricane Charley, Florida residents were faced with the arduous task of sorting through the wreckage, and for some, starting over again.
title: Charley's Force Took Experts by Surprise (AP)
description: AP - Hurricane Charley's 145-mph force took forecasters by surprise and showed just how shaky a science it still is to predict a storm's intensity #151; even with all the latest satellite and radar technology.
title: Charley Grinds Through Coastal Carolinas (AP)
description: AP - A weakening Tropical Storm Charley sloshed through North Carolina's eastern counties on Saturday, doing little more than damaging trees and causing power outages after devastating the west coast of Florida.
title: Bush Plans to Cut Forces in Europe, Asia (AP)
description: AP - President Bush has decided to bring home tens of thousands of U.S. troops from posts around the world #151; most of them in Europe and Asia #151; plus 100,000 of their family members and support personnel, U.S. officials said Saturday.
title: Wildfire Sweeps by Old Calif. Mining Town (AP)
description: AP - A wind-fueled wildfire roared through an old mining town near Redding on Sunday, destroying 20 homes and forcing nearly 125 residents to flee, officials said. The blaze broke out Saturday afternoon and quickly grew to 2,500 acres, sweeping through the mountain community of French Gulch, about 20 miles east of Redding, said Linda Galvan, spokeswoman for the California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection.
title: Memorial Service Held for Lori Hacking (AP)
description: AP - Family and friends of Lori Hacking gathered Saturday for a memorial service to remember the woman whom authorities believe was slain by her husband while she slept.
title: 'American Taliban' Lawyer Seeks Reversal (AP)
description: AP - The attorney for American-born Taliban soldier John Walker Lindh says Lindh's case should be reconsidered now that another U.S. citizen captured on an Afghanistan battlefield may soon be released.
title: McGreevey's Missteps Aided in Downfall (AP)
description: AP - From liberal Massachusetts to conservative Arizona, gay politicians have gone public and survived. New Jersey Gov. James E. McGreevey's decision to come out on live television could have made him the most prominent among them #151; the nation's first openly gay governor.
title: Judge Nixes Pa. Clergy Sex Abuse Lawsuits (AP)
description: AP - Seventeen adults who sued the Philadelphia archdiocese for alleged child sexual abuse by Roman Catholic clergy waited too long to file suit, a judge ruled.
title: Greek Community in NYC Celebrates Olympics (AP)
description: AP - Inside the Athens Cafe in Astoria, Queens #151; the neighborhood at the heart of New York City's Greek-American community #151; Costas Maurikis beamed as the gold-glowing Acropolis appeared on television.
title: Florida Retiree Town Devastated by Storm (AP)
description: AP - Where Calusa Indians once fought off early Spanish attempts to colonize, retirees and families seeking a slower pace and a sunny, affordable climate had turned Punta Gorda, or "Broad Point," into a comfortable community along the Gulf of Mexico.
title: Hurricane Survivors Haunted by Bodies (AP)
description: AP - When Cindy Vallier returned home Saturday after Hurricane Charley, the bodies of the old couple across the road were lying in her front yard, covered in blankets.
title: Acting Columbo Mob Boss Pleads Guilty (AP)
description: AP - The acting boss of the Columbo crime family pleaded guilty in a mistaken mob hit on a 78-year-old judge whose son, a former prosecutor, was the intended target.
title: Democratic Senator Urges Energy Reform (AP)
description: AP - Congress must pass legislation to protect the nation's electricity grid if it wants to avoid repeats of the devastating outages that rolled across eight states last year, Sen. Maria Cantwell, D-Wash., said Saturday.
title: Chicago Suburb Targets Underage Partying (AP)
description: AP - Jennifer Gilligan says she wasn't drinking at the party and didn't know other underage people were. But when Naperville Police pulled up, the 20-year-old and more than a dozen others were ticketed, not for underage drinking, but for simply being at a party where their peers had alcohol.
title: 'Passion' Killer Gets 75-Year Sentence (AP)
description: AP - A man who said the movie "The Passion of the Christ" prompted him to confess to strangling his girlfriend has been sentenced to 75 years in prison.
title: Ruling Leaves Gays Unsure of Benefits (AP)
description: AP - With their same-sex marriages yanked away by the California Supreme Court, many gay and lesbian couples were left wondering Friday what will happen to the benefits they briefly received, such as family insurance discounts and medical coverage.
title: Man Says McGreevey Made Sexual Advances (AP)
description: AP - Was he a powerful politician, forcing himself on a young aide? Or was it consensual? A day after New Jersey Gov. James E. McGreevey made history by announcing his resignation over an affair with another man, Golan Cipel gave his side of the story.
title: Bush Promises Aid to Hurricane Victims (AP)
description: AP - President Bush asked his supporters Saturday to pray for Hurricane Charley victims and announced that he will visit Florida to survey the damage.
title: Campaign takes hard right past H'wood (Variety)
description: Variety - VICKSBURG, Miss. -- On the eve of what is arguably the most important presidential election in decades, Hollywood has again become a lightning rod. It simply takes a trip out of town to see the extent to which that is true.
title: Kerry leading Bush in key swing states (AFP)
description: AFP - Although polls show the US presidential race a virtual dead heat, Democrat John Kerry appears to be gaining an edge over George W. Bush among the key states that could decide the outcome.
title: Oldest Heinz Son Pursues Hands-On Activism (AP)
description: AP - Teresa Heinz Kerry once hinted at tensions with her first-born son, a 37-year-old blacksmith who seeks an anonymous life with his wife and child in rural Pennsylvania.
title: Poll: Bush Tops Kerry As a Strong Leader (AP)
description: AP - President Bush retains an advantage with voters on such qualities as decisiveness and strength of leadership despite the Democrats' effort to promote John Kerry as a strong leader, a poll this week finds.
title: Democratic Senator Urges Energy Reform (AP)
description: AP - Congress must pass legislation to protect the nation's electricity grid if it wants to avoid repeats of the devastating outages that rolled across eight states last year, Sen. Maria Cantwell, D-Wash., said Saturday.
title: Kerry Says His Daughter Has Won Fulbright (AP)
description: AP - Democratic presidential nominee John Kerry said Saturday that his daughter Vanessa has won a Fulbright scholarship to study medicine in London.
title: Never a hostile question for campaigning Bush (AFP)
description: AFP - President George W. Bush famously dislikes press conferences but has embraced "Ask President Bush" sessions packed with supporters at least as eager to pay tribute to him as get an answer.
title: Bush Tells Crowd Kerry Will Raise Taxes (AP)
description: AP - Trying to energize the electorate in heavily Republican western Iowa, President Bush hammered home the message Saturday that voters must keep rival John Kerry out of the White House because the Democrat will raise taxes on the middle class.
title: Kerry Campaign Helping With Fla. Recovery (AP)
description: AP - Democratic presidential candidate John Kerry does not plan to visit Florida in the aftermath of Hurricane Charley because he's concerned his campaign entourage could distract from recovery efforts, he said Saturday.
title: Edwards Calls for Changes to Drug Plans (AP)
description: AP - Democratic vice presidential candidate John Edwards called for changes to prescription drug programs and praised running mate John Kerry's military and government service at an outdoor campaign rally here Saturday.
title: Government Aims to Curb Political Groups (AP)
description: AP - Government lawyers are renewing their push to rein in groups like those spending millions on ads and voter outreach in the presidential race.
title: Bush to Visit Hurricane-Damaged Florida (Reuters)
description: Reuters - President Bush wrapped up a\five-day campaign swing with a rally in the battleground state\of Iowa on Saturday and scheduled a quick trip to Florida to\survey hurricane damage in a state he needs to win in the
title: Kerry Makes Most of 'Dead' Campaign Time (AP)
description: AP - On the last day of a two-week march from the Atlantic to the Pacific, tens of thousands of people stood under a hot sun on a bank of the Willamette River to hear John Kerry explain why he should be elected president.
title: Kerry Asks Campaign Workers to Help Charley Victims (Reuters)
description: Reuters - Democrat John Kerry on\Saturday asked his presidential campaign workers in Florida to\help in recovery efforts after Hurricane Charley, but said he\had no immediate plans to visit the devastated communities.
title: Bush Ad Assails Kerry on Intel Reforms (AP)
description: AP - President Bush assails rival Sen. John Kerry on intelligence reform, arguing in a new television ad that the Democrat's pledge to fix the system is at odds with his record and concluding, "There's what Kerry says, and then there's what Kerry does."
title: Bush to visit Florida with Kerry's support (AFP)
description: AFP - US President George W. Bush announced he would visit Florida Sunday to survey the devastation wrought by Hurricane Charley and try to comfort those afflicted by the deadly storm.
title: Kerry, wrapping up cross-country tour, cheered by 60,000 in Pacific Northwest (AFP)
description: AFP - Democratic presidential hopeful John Kerry wrapped up a two-week bus and train tour of the United States in the Pacific Northwest, cheered by tens of thousands at a star-studded rally.
title: Bush threatens possible WTO case against Airbus (AFP)
description: AFP - US President George W. Bush warned that the United States may bring WTO action in September against Airbus Industrie, citing "unfair" government subsidies to the European aircraft maker.
title: Bush hails Afghan, Iraqi athletes' participation in Olympics (AFP)
description: AFP - US President George W. Bush hailed the participation of Afghan and Iraqi athletes in the Athens Olympics, saying they were now representing nations free from "tyranny and repression."
title: Debate Panel May Have Made 2000 Blunder (AP)
description: AP - The Commission on Presidential Debates may have violated federal election laws when it refused to allow any third-party presidential candidates into the debate halls to watch the 2000 presidential debates, a federal judge has ruled.
title: Bush, Kerry Trade Charges Over Tax Cuts (AP)
description: AP - President Bush traded one refrain for another Friday, saying he is "getting the job done" on the economy and more. Not so, said Sen. John Kerry, criticizing administration tax cuts as insensitive to the middle class as he ended a 22-state tour.
title: Bush, Edgar Martinez Exchange Baseballs (AP)
description: AP - President Bush and veteran Seattle Mariners designated hitter Edgar Martinez exchanged signed baseballs Friday.
title: U.S. Could Go to WTO Over Airbus Subsidies -- Bush (Reuters)
description: Reuters - President Bush complained about\European subsidies for Airbus on Friday and threatened to take\a case to the World Trade Organization if they were not ended.
title: CBO Report: Bush Tax Cuts Tilted to Rich (Reuters)
description: Reuters - One-third of President Bush's tax\cuts have gone to the wealthiest 1 percent of Americans,\shifting more burden to middle-income taxpayers, congressional\analysts said on Friday.
title: Bush Assails Kerry on Intel in New TV Ad (AP)
description: AP - President Bush assails rival Sen. John Kerry on intelligence reform, arguing in a new television ad that the Democrat's pledge to fix the system is at odds with his record and concluding, "There's what Kerry says, and then there's what Kerry does."
title: US anti-war, Arab-American groups sue New York over Central Park rally permit (AFP)
description: AFP - An Arab-American organization and a group opposed to war and racism filed suit charging they were unconstitutionally denied a permit to hold a protest in Central Park during the upcoming Republican National Convention.
title: New York City Sued for Blocking Civil Rights Rally (Reuters)
description: Reuters - An Arab American organization and an\anti-war group said on Friday they have sued New York City for\blocking a huge civil rights rally in Central Park just before\the start of the Republican National Convention.
title: Results of Latest Presidential Polls (AP)
description: AP - Results of recent polls on the presidential race. Listed above each set of results is the name of the 2000 winner in a given state, the organization that conducted the poll, the dates, the number interviewed, whether it was adults, registered voters (RV) or likely voters (LV) and the margin of error (MoE). Results may not total 100 percent because of rounding.
title: Bush, Kerry Spar Over Tax Cuts in Oregon (Reuters)
description: Reuters - President Bush and his Democrat\rival Sen. John Kerry sparred on Friday over the wisdom of\giving tax cuts to the wealthy as their two campaigns converged\on the battleground state of Oregon.
title: Notes and Quotes From Campaign 2004 (AP)
description: AP - Sen. John Kerry's Nevada supporters said they liked what he had to say #151; though not with his East Coast accent #151; when he campaigned in the state this week.
title: Bush backer: Kerry would emulate France (AFP)
description: AFP - On the same day that US President George W. Bush made perhaps his strongest defense of French foreign policy, a top backer derided Democratic White House hopeful John Kerry for wanting the United States to "act like the French."
title: Labor Unions Mobilize for Kerry Campaign (AP)
description: AP - Labor has much to offer Sen. John Kerry in his quest for the presidency: a massive voter mobilization machine that is backed by well more than #36;157 million and was fine-tuned by union leaders this week.
title: Republicans to tout Bush "leadership" at convention (AFP)
description: AFP - President George W. Bush's campaign played down the possibility that the Republican national convention this month would give him a significant "bounce" in his tight re-election race against Democrat John Kerry.
title: GOP Staging 'Masquerade Ball,' Dems Say (AP)
description: AP - First, Republicans accused Democrats of staging an "extreme makeover" convention in Boston last month in an effort to portray John Kerry as anything but liberal.
title: Bush Backs Off Idea of National Sales Tax (AP)
description: AP - President Bush is distancing himself from suggestions that he wants to replace the federal income tax with a national sales tax, saying "People shouldn't worry about me raising taxes."
title: Lehrer to Get Help in Moderating Debates (AP)
description: AP - Jim Lehrer, host of PBS's "News Hour," will be a moderator for the presidential debates, but unlike past election years, he will divide the work with ABC's Charlie Gibson and CBS's Bob Schieffer.
title: Kerry consistent on Iraq ... mostly (AFP)
description: AFP - While Republicans are trying to keep Democratic presidential candidate John Kerry on the ropes for alleged flip-flops on Iraq, his position has in fact been largely consistent with a couple of exceptions.
title: Kerry Opens Leads in Several Key States (AP)
description: AP - Sen. John Kerry has opened narrow leads in Florida, Michigan, New Hampshire and a handful of other battleground state polls since accepting the Democratic nomination, increasing pressure on President Bush to regain lost ground at the Republican National Convention.
title: Bush says he's ready to take "rap" over Iraq (AFP)
description: AFP - President George W. Bush said he was ready to take "the rap" for the Iraq war if the US people decided in November to elect his Democratic rival John Kerry, whose Vietnam war record, he said, was something to be proud of.
title: Democrats See Nader As a Menace on Margins (AP)
description: AP - He's dropped in polls that gave him one lonely digit to begin with and seen friends peel away #151; even fall melodramatically to their knees begging him to quit. Even a little bit of Ralph Nader is too much for Democrats.
title: Bush Declines to Condemn Attack Ads on Kerry (Reuters)
description: Reuters - President Bush praised John Kerry's\military service as honorable on Thursday but declined to\condemn ads from Vietnam veterans who questioned the\Massachusetts senator's military record.
title: Cheney Criticizes Kerry's Terror War Plan (AP)
description: AP - Vice President Dick Cheney on Thursday questioned Sen. John Kerry's call for a "more sensitive" war on terror, saying it won't impress the Sept. 11 terrorists or the Islamic militants who have beheaded U.S. citizens #151; criticism Kerry dismissed as negative politics.
title: White House Sees Critical Period for Terror (Reuters)
description: Reuters - The presidential election campaign\has entered a two-month period when the threat of an al Qaeda\attack to disrupt the process could be greatest, a White House\official warned on Thursday.
title: Cheney Mocks Kerry's 'Sensitive' War on Terror (Reuters)
description: Reuters - Vice President Dick Cheney mocked\Democratic presidential candidate John Kerry on Thursday for\pledging to wage a more "sensitive" war against terrorism.
title: President Bush Pays Visit to Nancy Reagan (Reuters)
description: Reuters - President Bush paid a visit to\former First Lady Nancy Reagan on Thursday in a sign of easing\tensions between the Bush and Reagan families despite their\disagreement over stem-cell research.
title: Bush, Kerry Chase Each Other Across U.S. (AP)
description: AP - President Bush and Democratic opponent John Kerry seem to be playing a modern version of "Me and My Shadow" these days. The two presidential candidates keep popping up in the same states within days of each other #151; sometimes within hours.
title: Bush Seen Taking Incremental Tax-Reform Approach (Reuters)
description: Reuters - President Bush is likely to tout tax\reform as a broad campaign theme but nothing as sweeping as a\national sales tax, despite recent warm words, Republican\sources said on Thursday.
title: Court Rules Against Anti-Abortion Group (AP)
description: AP - A federal court on Thursday ruled against an anti-abortion group that wants to run ads in Wisconsin that mention Democratic Sen. Russ Feingold, who is up for re-election this year.
title: Education Group's Ads Assail Bush (AP)
description: AP - An interest group funded in part by the nation's largest teachers' union will launch #36;2.5 million worth of new commercials on Friday assailing President Bush's education reform law after spending several million dollars on television ads this summer.
title: Kerry touts Clinton economy, slams Bush record (AFP)
description: AFP - Democratic White House hopeful John Kerry launched a two-week tour focusing on the economy as a new poll showed President George W. Bush vulnerable on the key campaign issue.
title: A Look at States Where Kerry Has Improved (AP)
description: AP - Democrat John Kerry has gained ground on President Bush in several states in recent weeks, while independent Ralph Nader remains a factor.
title: Mattel Puts Barbie on Campaign Trail (Reuters)
description: Reuters - Look out Bush and Kerry, Barbie's\making a run for the White House.
title: Poll Gives Kerry 6-Point Lead Over Bush in Florida (Reuters)
description: Reuters - Democrat John Kerry leads\President Bush 47 percent to 41 percent among registered voters\in Florida, according to a poll released on Thursday that\showed independent Ralph Nader with 4 percent.
title: Newsview: Bush Draws Kerry Into Iraq Fray (AP)
description: AP - With fighting flaring in an increasingly unpopular war in Iraq, President Bush hopes to draw Democratic Sen. John Kerry into a different kind of battle and destroy his claim as a veteran qualified for command in an age of terrorism.
title: Republicans, Democrats clash bitterly over anti-terror war (AFP)
description: AFP - Republicans and Democrats clashed bitterly over the war on terrorism, with Vice President Dick Cheney heaping scorn on a call by presidential candidate John Kerry for a more "sensitive" campaign involving other nations.
title: Kerry Hits Hot Spots in Western Swing (AP)
description: AP - The thermometer read 114 degrees when John Kerry left his air-conditioned campaign bus to gaze up at an electronic sign that locals call the world's tallest thermometer.
title: Kerry scouring hinterlands for last undecided voter (AFP)
description: AFP - Democratic candidate John Kerry, with a paper-thin lead over President George W. Bush, is wooing the most rural newspapers in the smallest towns in the American heartland in a relentless quest for that last undecided voter.
title: Kerry Takes Lead Over Bush in Florida (AP)
description: AP - Democrat John Kerry has taken a slight lead over President Bush in Florida #151; the essential swing state in the 2000 election, according to a poll out Thursday.
title: Bush, Kerry, dueling over Saudi Arabia (AFP)
description: AFP - Much the way their predecessors warred over Sino-US ties in past elections, US President George W. Bush and Democratic White House hopeful John Kerry are trading blows over Saudi Arabia.
title: Uncounted Ballots Hold Primary in Limbo (AP)
description: AP - Hundreds of uncounted ballots clouded the outcome Wednesday of a tight Republican congressional primary in which the top two candidates were separated by 275 votes out of more than 30,000 cast.
title: Train Conductor Suspended for Kerry Quip (AP)
description: AP - An Amtrak conductor has been suspended without pay for telling his train passengers that they should vote against Democratic presidential candidate John Kerry.
title: Kerry courts senior voters, takes aim at Bush health care policy (AFP)
description: AFP - US Democratic presidential candidate John Kerry decried President George W. Bush's health care policy, saying Americans are paying too much for medication while neighboring Canadians are able to buy cheaper prescription drugs.
title: Bush assails Kerry over Iraq withdrawal pledge (AFP)
description: AFP - US President George W. Bush assailed Democratic White House hopeful John Kerry's pledge, if elected, to slash US troop levels in Iraq by next August.
title: Najaf fighting keeps Iraq in US voters' eyes (AFP)
description: AFP - Fighting in the Shiite city of Najaf is keeping Iraq on the front pages of US newspapers, to the likely discomfort of President George W. Bush whose policies there have become a key issue in his re-election bid.
title: Milestone of 1,000th U.S. Death in Iraq Looms for Bush (Reuters)
description: Reuters - The United States faces a painful\moment probably next month when its military deaths in Iraq are\expected to surpass 1,000. It will also be a crucial moment for\President Bush, who faces a presidential campaign in which Iraq\is a central issue.
title: Unions Court Retirees to Vote for Kerry (AP)
description: AP - From union swing voters to retirees, organized labor is trying to wring out every vote possible for John Kerry in November.
title: Coors Wins Senate Primary Race in Colo. (AP)
description: AP - The great-grandson of beer baron Adolph Coors handily won the Republican primary for Colorado's U.S. Senate seat, triggering a face-off with the state's Democratic attorney general this fall. In Georgia, a Democrat became the first black candidate ever nominated to the U.S. Senate from that state.
title: Rumsfeld Says Drugs a New Threat to Afghan Future (Reuters)
description: Reuters - The war against terror was being won in\Afghanistan, but the country faced a new danger that threatened\the entire international community, Secretary of Defense Donald\Rumsfeld warned on Wednesday.
title: Kerry: No nuclear waste for Nevada (AFP)
description: AFP - Democratic presidential nominee John Kerry said Nevada should not be home to a nuclear waste site under Yucca Mountain.
title: Anti-Kerry Book Author Sorry for Slurs (AP)
description: AP - One of the authors of a new anti-John Kerry book frequently posted comments on a conservative Web site describing Muslims and Catholics as pedophiles and Pope John Paul II as senile.
title: Bush crows over Kerry's acknowledgement on Iraq vote (AFP)
description: AFP - President George W. Bush claimed political vindication after Democratic rival John Kerry said he would have authorised military action in Iraq even knowing what he knows today.
title: U.S. to Speed Up Immigrant Deportations (AP)
description: AP - The day before President Bush was to campaign in Arizona and New Mexico, the Homeland Security Department announced it would hasten deportations of illegal immigrants who are not Mexican or Canadian citizens.
title: Poll: Older Americans Unhappy with Medicare Changes (Reuters)
description: Reuters - Older Americans are confused and\unhappy about upcoming changes in the federal Medicare health\program, according to a nonpartisan survey released on Tuesday\that indicates the issue could help Democrats win the November\vote.
title: NY Activists Press for Anti-Bush Rally in Park (Reuters)
description: Reuters - Authorities on Tuesday spurned a new\bid by an anti-war group to stage the biggest rally of the\Republican convention in Central Park after activists rejected\a site chosen by New York police.
title: Groups File Complaint Over Anti-Kerry Ad (AP)
description: AP - Three campaign finance watchdog groups filed a complaint Tuesday accusing a group of Vietnam veterans of violating the campaign finance law by airing an ad that challenges Democratic presidential nominee John Kerry's military record.
title: Can a Candidate Be Too Conservative in Bush Country? (Reuters)
description: Reuters - A battle is raging for the Texas\congressional seat that represents President Bush's adopted\home of Crawford, and redistricting, religion and a\cross-dressing scandal are weighing in the race.
title: Top Texas Democrat Seeks Party's Funds (AP)
description: AP - The Texas Democratic Party chairman wants financial donors in the state to stop sending money to the national party because he says officials there are treating it as a Republican state where Democrats can't win.
title: US withdrawal from Iraq depends on security, diplomacy - Kerry (AFP)
description: AFP - Chances for the United States to reduce its military forces in Iraq within one year will depend on security on the ground and advances in US diplomacy, US Democratic presidential candidate John Kerry said.
title: First Lady Bashes Kerry Stem Cell Stance (AP)
description: AP - First lady Laura Bush, defending her husband's policy on embryonic stem cell research, accuses proponents of overstating the potential for medical breakthroughs and says it is "ridiculous" for John Kerry to claim the president has banned the research.
title: Bush runs afoul of Irish-Americans over Iraq contract (AFP)
description: AFP - US President George W. Bush has landed in hot water with Irish-Americans, whose leading lobbying group warned he could lose Irish Catholic votes in the November election, unless his administration revokes an Iraq security contract granted to a British firm.
title: Kerry promises national parks reforms during Grand Canyon visit (AFP)
description: AFP - US Democratic presidential candidate John Kerry on Monday stopped at the Grand Canyon, Arizona, where he announced his intention to reform management of US national parks.
title: Labor Leaders Focus on Ousting Bush (AP)
description: AP - Still smarting from a public spat during the Democratic National Convention, labor leaders on Monday tried to shift attention to ousting President Bush.
title: Foreign Monitors to Report on U.S. Presidential Vote (Reuters)
description: Reuters - Major international monitors will\issue an unprecedented report on the handling of this year's\U.S. presidential election, after the 2000 vote raised concerns\of disenfranchisement, U.S. officials said on Monday.
title: Thousands of U.S. Felons Wrongly Denied Vote, Groups Say (Reuters)
description: Reuters - Tens of thousands of former felons could\be illegally denied their right to vote in this year's U.S.\presidential election in November because of bureaucratic\bungling and misinformation, activists said on Monday.
title: First Lady, Edwards Clash Over Bush Stem Cell Policy (Reuters)
description: Reuters - First lady Laura Bush and Democratic\vice presidential nominee John Edwards clashed on Monday over\whether President Bush's restrictions on stem cell research\should be maintained or lifted.
title: Democrats launch full-bore attack on Bush economic policies (AFP)
description: AFP - US Democrats, seeking to reap political hay from new barren economic data, launched a full-bore assault on President George W. Bush's policies and assertion the country had "turned a corner."
title: OSCE observers to witness US presidential election (AFP)
description: AFP - The United States said it had invited a team of experts from the Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe (OSCE) to observe this year's US presidential election in line with commitments the group's members have made to each other.
title: Bush: White House does not control monetary policy (AFP)
description: AFP - The White House does not dictate monetary policy, President George W. Bush said while again highlighting his optimism for the US economy.
title: Democrats Edwards, Obama Campaign in Ill. (AP)
description: AP - Diners at Manny's Coffee Shop and Deli got a little star power with their corned beef on rye Monday as Democrats John Edwards and Barack Obama campaigned together at the South Side institution.
title: Kerry's Win in 1982 Propelled His Career (AP)
description: AP - A decade after he lost a bid for the U.S. House, John Kerry faced a choice: build a respectable, mainstream career in Boston's legal circles or wade back into the muddy waters of Massachusetts politics.
title: Edwards Pays a Makeup Call in Kansas (AP)
description: AP - Supporters stood in the dark as the John Kerry-John Edwards campaign train sped through town in the wee hours of Saturday. They got their chance to spend time with half the ticket Sunday when Edwards and his family paid a makeup call in a rare Democratic foray into a traditionally Republican stronghold.
title: Kerry Stops for Voters' Homemade Signs (AP)
description: AP - At this small town on a rail track, supporters brought John Kerry's train to a halt with a homemade sign made of white bedsheets asking for just a few minutes of his time.
title: Maverick McCain plays both sides of US presidential campaign (AFP)
description: AFP - As a maverick Republican and Vietnam war soulmate of Democratic challenger John Kerry, Senator John McCain is walking a thin political line in this year's presidential election and apparently relishing every moment.
title: John Kerry blessed in Navajo country (AFP)
description: AFP - Navajo and Zuni Indians showed their support for Democratic presidential hopeful John Kerry in traditional fashion, blessing him with eagle feathers said to chase away evil spirits at a Native American pow-wow here.
title: Newsview: Focus Shifts From Kerry to Bush (AP)
description: AP - With the spotlight on his candidacy, John Kerry improved public perception of his character and qualifications but failed to shake-up the presidential race. Now, the focus shifts to President Bush #151; and all his hurdles to re-election.
title: Keyes to Challenge Obama for U.S. Senate Seat (Reuters)
description: Reuters - Failed presidential candidate Alan\Keyes said on Sunday he would wage a campaign against favored\Democrat Barack Obama in the race for a Republican-held U.S.\Senate seat from Illinois.
title: California Plans to Hold Primary in June (AP)
description: AP - California, the big prize in presidential politics, may be about to give up its eight-year quest for more clout in picking presidential nominees.
title: Heinz Kerry Dances on Campaign Trail (AP)
description: AP - The hour was late, the day had been long, but Teresa Heinz Kerry felt like dancing. As a six-piece Mariachi band played at the train station Saturday night and her husband signed autographs a few feet away, she began to sway to the music. A young gentleman in the welcoming party, Javier Martinez of Albuquerque, gallantly offered his hand and soon they were dancing to the lively strains of "El Rey."
title: Franks Says Kerry Qualified for President (AP)
description: AP - Retired Gen. Tommy Franks, producer of the early military successes in Afghanistan and Iraq, said Sunday that criticism of John Kerry's war record is political hyperbole and Kerry is "absolutely" qualified to be commander in chief.
title: Nader Doesn't Get Spot on California Ballot (Reuters)
description: Reuters - Consumer advocate Ralph Nader did\not collect enough signatures to make the ballot in California\as an independent presidential candidate but his spokesman said\on Sunday the campaign would keep trying.
title: Keyes Will Run for Senate in Illinois (AP)
description: AP - Alan Keyes, the conservative Maryland political commentator whom Illinois Republicans turned to after weeks of searching for a replacement Senate candidate, agreed Sunday to run against a rising Democratic star who has only grown stronger amid GOP scandal and disarray.
title: Kerry courts the Hispanic vote coveted by Republicans (AFP)
description: AFP - From the deck of the caboose where Harry Truman once stumped for the presidency, Democratic presidential candidate John Kerry calls out "Buenas Tardes" (good afternoon) and "gracias" (thank you) as he rolls through the heavily Hispanic American southwest.
title: Kerry Calls for More Stem-Cell Funding (AP)
description: AP - John Kerry said Saturday the restriction on stem cell research imposed by President Bush was a triumph of ideology over science and "only adds to the loss and pain" of millions suffering from potentially curable diseases.
title: Results of AP Poll on Candidates (AP)
description: AP - The Associated Press-Ipsos poll on the presidential race on based on telephone interviews with 1,001 adults, including 798 registered voters, from all states except Alaska and Hawaii. The interviews were conducted August 3-5 by Ipsos-Public Affairs.
title: Edwards Heads Back to Kansas to Apologize for Snub (Reuters)
description: Reuters - Democratic vice presidential\nominee John Edwards was to head to Lawrence, Kansas, on Sunday\to offer an apology for an inadvertent snub by presidential\hopeful John Kerry and himself.
title: Poll: Bush Approval Rating Drops in Calif. (Reuters)
description: Reuters - The percentage of Californians\who disapprove of President Bush's performance in office has\risen to 55 percent from 45 percent a year ago, according to a\poll released Sunday.
title: Kerry Seeks to Close Democrats' 'Religion Gap' (Reuters)
description: Reuters - Democratic presidential nominee John\Kerry has begun speaking more openly about his faith, a move\political experts say is crucial to chipping away at President\Bush's advantage among churchgoers.
title: Nader Fails to Make California Ballot (AP)
description: AP - Ralph Nader failed to gather enough signatures to make the ballot in California as an independent presidential candidate, but his campaign said Saturday it will keep trying to get the consumer activist's name before the state's voters in November.
title: Kerry promises to lift limits on stem cell research (AFP)
description: AFP - US Democratic presidential nominee John Kerry promised to lift limits on embryonic stem cell research if he wins the White House, drawing a sharp distinction between himself and President George W. Bush, who imposed the limits three years ago.
title: AP Poll: Kerry Gains Ground on Defense (AP)
description: AP - Democrat John Kerry is putting the pressure on President Bush on his strongest issue, national defense, but the incumbent retains an advantage there, an Associated Press poll found.
title: McCain to Stump With Bush in Three States (AP)
description: AP - Sen. John McCain will campaign this week with President Bush in Florida, New Mexico and his home state of Arizona, Bush's campaign said Saturday.
title: Kerry camp pans Bush's national security record (AFP)
description: AFP - Democratic presidential candidate John Kerry's campaign criticized President George W. Bush's handling of national security, saying the United States still has "much more" work ahead to protect itself from future terrorist attacks.
title: A bevy of books on Bush due in bookstores before balloting (AFP)
description: AFP - With less than 100 days to go to the US presidential election, dozens of new books criticizing President George W. Bush are about to flood US bookstores.
title: Colo. Seeing Tough Senate Primary Battles (AP)
description: AP - The conventional wisdom was that Peter Coors, the wealthy beer baron with a face for TV, would coast to the Republican nomination for Colorado's open Senate seat. And that Attorney General Ken Salazar, a veteran campaigner touting himself as a folksy farmer with deep Colorado roots, would grab the Democratic nod without a fight.
title: Court Orders New Chicago Mayoral Primary (AP)
description: AP - The Indiana Supreme Court on Friday ordered a new Democratic mayoral primary in East Chicago, saying the 2003 election in which the longtime mayor claimed victory was fraught with corruption.
title: Wartime Comrade Questions Kerry's Vietnam Record (Reuters)
description: Reuters - One of presidential candidate John\Kerry's Vietnam war comrades, who had appeared to back off his\criticism of Kerry's war record, recanted on Friday and said,\yes, in fact he did question whether the U.S. senator deserved\his medals.
title: Kerry would cut US dependence on foreign oil (AFP)
description: AFP - Presidential hopeful John Kerry said he would diversify US energy sources and cut US dependence on foreign oil.
title: Poor Jobs Figure a Sharp Blow to Bush - Analysts (Reuters)
description: Reuters - Disappointing job creation figures\issued Friday were a sharp blow to President Bush, making it\much more difficult for him to argue on the campaign trail that\the economy has turned the corner, analysts and pollsters said.
title: Bush: "More to do" on US economy (AFP)
description: AFP - US President George W. Bush declared that anemic job creation in July showed that there is "more to do" to help the US economy and urged voters to give him a second four-year term.
title: Pentagon Moves to Improve Troubled Military Voting (Reuters)
description: Reuters - Stung by voting problems four years\ago, the Pentagon announced on Friday it was pressing to\improve absentee balloting by the U.S. military and civilians\overseas in what could be a close 2004 presidential election.
title: Poll: John Kerry Enjoys Wide Lead in California (Reuters)
description: Reuters - Democratic presidential nominee\John Kerry has a strong lead over President Bush in California,\a state that has voted Democratic in recent national elections,\according to a poll released on Friday.
title: Kerry, Edwards Swap One-Liners with Hecklers (Reuters)
description: Reuters - From the platform of the same\train car from which U.S. President Harry Truman gave\Republicans "hell" in 1948, John Kerry and John Edwards caught\fresh jeers.
title: Kerry's #36;80 Million in Ads Buys Him Cover (AP)
description: AP - John Kerry shelled out #36;80 million over five months to plaster television screens with campaign ads trumpeting his biography and priorities. So what did all that money get him? An even race.
title: Anti-Kerry Group Seeks Press Exemption (AP)
description: AP - A conservative group that complained about television ads for Michael Moore's anti-Bush documentary "Fahrenheit 9/11" now wants an exemption from campaign finance laws so it can advertise a book on John Kerry.
title: Powell Rejects Kerry Assertion on Iraq (AP)
description: AP - Secretary of State Colin Powell dismissed assertions Thursday by Democratic presidential candidate John Kerry that failed diplomacy by the Bush administration deprived the United States of Arab and European support in the Iraq war.
title: Bush campaign unveils new Spanish ad (AFP)
description: AFP - US President George W. Bush's campaign launched a new Spanish television spot as the Republican battles for the Hispanic vote against Democratic presidential hopeful John Kerry.
title: Bush to Air Spanish Ads in Colorado (AP)
description: AP - President Bush's re-election campaign added Colorado to the list of states where it's advertising in Spanish as it rolled out a new television commercial Thursday that says America has "opened its heart" to Hispanics under the Republican.
title: Texan Bankrolls Anti-Kerry Vets Group (AP)
description: AP - A wealthy Texan and prolific Republican donor is helping bankroll a television ad assailing Democrat John Kerry's decorated military record in the Vietnam War.
title: Democrats Stake Presence in Kennebunkport (AP)
description: AP - There's an unmistakable campaign sign for president on the way to the Bush family estate on Maine's rocky coast. Its message? Kennebunkport is for Kerry.
title: Republicans strike back at Kerry's criticism of Bush's Sept. 11 response (AFP)
description: AFP - Republicans struck back at John Kerry after the Democratic presidential candidate criticized President George W. Bush for sitting in a Florida classroom for seven minutes after being informed about the September 11, 2001, attacks.
title: McCain Condemns Anti-Kerry Ad (AP)
description: AP - Republican Sen. John McCain, a former prisoner of war in Vietnam, called an ad criticizing John Kerry's military service "dishonest and dishonorable" and urged the White House on Thursday to condemn it as well.
title: Kerry Opposes Media Consolidation Trend (Reuters)
description: Reuters - Democratic presidential nominee John\Kerry said on Thursday he opposes the push for media\consolidation and would pursue a policy aimed at broad and\diverse ownership of media outlets.
title: White House repudiates anti-Kerry ad (AFP)
description: AFP - The White House distanced itself from a commercial by a controversial veterans' group that accuses Democratic presidential hopeful John Kerry of lying about his service in Vietnam.
title: Springsteen breaks partisan neutrality, backs John Kerry (AFP)
description: AFP - Rock legend Bruce Springsteen, overcoming a career-long aversion to partisan politics, laid out his case for ousting President George W. Bush in an editorial in the New York Times' latest issue.
title: Kerry's Wife Considered Key Campaign Asset (AP)
description: AP - Forget polite sensibilities. Many women along the Democratic campaign trail are telling Teresa Heinz Kerry to keep speaking her mind. To them, the sassy, gabby wife of presidential candidate John Kerry is a key part of the package they want to put in the White House.
title: Springsteen Gets Political with Attack on Bush (Reuters)
description: Reuters - Rocker Bruce Springsteen has stayed\out of party politics for 25 years, but now he says the stakes\are too high and he's urging fellow Americans to vote President\Bush out of office in November.
title: Kerry Has Double-Digit Lead in N.J. (AP)
description: AP - John Kerry has reclaimed a healthy lead in Democratic-leaning New Jersey, where he holds a double-digit lead over President Bush, according to a Quinnipiac University poll released Thursday.
title: 3 Banks Robbed During Bush, Kerry Visit (AP)
description: AP - Three banks were robbed while President Bush and Democratic nominee John Kerry were speaking just blocks away from one another Wednesday morning.
title: Top non-political US cabinet members team up to rebut Kerry (AFP)
description: AFP - Two formally non-political members of George W. Bush's cabinet have fired a double-barreled shot in the direction of Democratic presidential nominee John Kerry, rebutting his criticism of the president's foreign policy and the conduct of the war in Iraq.
title: Bush Moves to Keep Sensitive Land Out of Crops (Reuters)
description: Reuters - Farmers will get an early chance to\re-enroll the more than 16 million acres due to leave the\Conservation Reserve beginning in 2007 -- half of the land in\the long-term reserve, President (George W.) Bush said on\Wednesday during a Midwest tour.
title: In Iowa Fight, Kerry Waves Corn, Bush Eats It Raw (Reuters)
description: Reuters - Competing for votes in\corn-growing Iowa, John Kerry waved to crowds with one ear in\each hand. Not to be outdone by his Democratic rival, President\Bush ate one raw.
title: Iowa Robbers Get Busy During Candidates' Visits (Reuters)
description: Reuters - Figuring Davenport police were\preoccupied with simultaneous visits by President Bush and\Democratic presidential hopeful John Kerry, three bank robbers\went to work on Wednesday, police said.
title: N.Y. Probes Democrat Convention Parties (AP)
description: AP - A state watchdog organization is investigating whether parties and events thrown by three companies at last week's Democratic National Convention violated state law, a source told The Associated Press.
title: Kerry Trip Includes GOP Strongholds (AP)
description: AP - The stops on John Kerry's cross-country campaign trip are hardly Democratic bastions. So much so, that on Wednesday he and President Bush campaigned just a few blocks from each other in this Iowa city.
title: Kerry picks up endorsement of some 200 business leaders (AFP)
description: AFP - Democratic presidential nominee John Kerry picked up endorsements from some 200 business leaders as he sought to boost his standing on economic issues.
title: Taxpayers Pay for FEC Convention Trips (AP)
description: AP - The three Democrats at the agency responsible for enforcing campaign finance rules attended last week's Democratic convention at taxpayers' expense, and Republican members of the Federal Election Commission plan to do the same later this month.
title: Kerry promises to cut budget deficit by half (AFP)
description: AFP - Democratic presidential nominee John Kerry promised to cut in half the size of the US budget deficit in his first term in office and accused the administration of President George W. Bush of conducting an irresponsible fiscal policy.
title: Democrats Roll Out 'Bush Truth Squad' (AP)
description: AP - Democrats rolled out a "Bush truth squad" Tuesday to state the facts as they see them and challenge the president's assertions at every turn of the campaign.
title: Terror Alerts Knock Democrats Off Balance (AP)
description: AP - The politics of terrorism has Democrats tied in knots. Each time President Bush raises fears of a possible attack, the political debate shifts from his most troublesome issue (Iraq) to one of his strongest (the war on terrorism) while Democrats fight their impulse to question the president's motives.
title: Missouri Dumps Governor, Bans Gay Marriage (Reuters)
description: Reuters - Missouri voters on Tuesday\narrowly unseated Gov. Bob Holden as the Democratic party's\candidate for the November governor's race, and also approved a\constitutional amendment banning gay marriage.
title: Online Scams Pose as Kerry Campaign Fund-Raisers (Reuters)
description: Reuters - Scam artists posing as fund-raisers\for Democratic presidential nominee John Kerry are trying to\trick Internet users into sending them money, an Internet\security firm said on Tuesday.
title: Newsview: Networks Cede DNC Coverage (AP)
description: AP - Last week's message to the world from John Kerry: "Reporting for duty!"
title: Heinz Kerry Interprets Portuguese Query (AP)
description: AP - Teresa Heinz Kerry knows what her role is on the campaign #151; and she says it's not interpreter.
title: CBS Wins Last Week's Ratings Race (AP)
description: AP - In a week disrupted by nine hours of prime-time coverage of the Democratic National Convention, CBS emerged as the clear ratings winner. But the conventions didn't make much of a showing.
title: New Hampshire 'Snipper' Suspect Jailed Again (Reuters)
description: Reuters - The primary suspect in New Hampshire's\"Jack the Snipper" scare has been jailed again on charges of\trying to break into a woman's apartment in the middle of the\night, police said on Tuesday.
title: Critics Attack Kerry's Iraq Troops Plan (AP)
description: AP - John Kerry says he can "put a deal together" as president to drastically reduce U.S. troop strength in Iraq, a pledge reminiscent of Richard Nixon's secret plan to end the Vietnam War and Dwight D. Eisenhower's promise to stop fighting in Korea.
title: Polls Mixed on Kerry Post-Convention Gain (AP)
description: AP - The jury is out on whether presidential nominee John Kerry got a 'bounce' in the polls after the Democratic National Convention. Some surveys suggest he did; in others, he did not.
title: Kerry campaign satisfied with post convention polls (AFP)
description: AFP - The Democratic National Convention that took place last week in Boston, Massachusetts, has allowed Americans to learn more about the party's presidential nominee, John Kerry, and bolstered his image as a future commander-in-chief, the Kerry campaign said late Monday.
title: Saudis Unfazed by U.S. Talk of Energy Independence (Reuters)
description: Reuters - Saudis are not alarmed about Democratic\presidential nominee John Kerry's pledge to end U.S. dependence\on Saudi oil and believe Washington will remain reliant on the\kingdom, industry experts said Tuesday.
title: A presidential contest short on star power (Variety)
description: Variety - VIRTUALLY NO ONE is neutral about Bill Clinton, but even detractors acknowledge the former president's oratorical powers and seductive charm. His address at the Democratic National Convention dazzlingly displayed that smoothness, doubtless putting half the audience in a mood to disrobe.
title: Obama Attention Renews Interest in Memoir (AP)
description: AP - The surge of interest in Barack Obama after his speech to the Democratic National Convention is spilling over to a book he wrote a decade ago, with a first edition copy going for #36;255 on eBay and pre-release orders for a new edition already putting it on best-seller lists.
title: Heinz Kerry: Four More Years of 'Hell' if Bush Wins (Reuters)
description: Reuters - Teresa Heinz Kerry, the outspoken\wife of Democratic presidential nominee John Kerry, pulled no\punches on Monday in telling a rally what she thought of the\Bush administration -- hell.
title: 'Fahrenheit 9/11' Propels Wave of Political Films (Reuters)
description: Reuters - Want to get away from the Iraq war,\slanted news reporting and the mud-slinging presidential\election campaign that probably lies ahead?
title: Not Much Bounce for Kerry After Convention (Reuters)
description: Reuters - John Kerry's turn in the spotlight\at last week's Democratic convention did not give him much of a\bounce in opinion polls, but analysts said on Monday it was a\sign of the times rather than a danger sign for Kerry.
title: TUNING IN (Variety)
description: Variety - (Variety) The Democrats just convened in Boston to try and spark John Kerry's presidential aspirations, but for some reason I'm still fixated on the convention I attended the week before in San Diego --- one where, among other things, fans temporarily breathe life into dormant show-business careers.
title: Wall St. Sees Little to Fear from Kerry Presidency (Reuters)
description: Reuters - It might be too early to say Wall\Street's money managers are warming to the idea of John Kerry\as president, but an increasing number are taking the idea\seriously.
title: Armstrong's Bracelet Worn by Bush, Kerry (AP)
description: AP - John Kerry wears one. President Bush has one, too. So do several celebrities.
title: Kerry Decries Bush Anti-Terror Policy (AP)
description: AP - Democratic presidential nominee John Kerry said Monday that President Bush has responded too slowly to the terrorist threat three years after the Sept. 11 attacks and has adopted policies that have encouraged terrorism.
title: Kerry Talks Openly About Faith and Guns (AP)
description: AP - John Kerry is talking more openly about his personal connection to God and guns as he kicks off the general election campaign asking for support from conservative-leaning independent voters.
title: US election is hawks versus hawks, as Democrats flex muscles (AFP)
description: AFP - The program was crammed with aging combat veterans and retired military brass. The presidential candidate strode up to the podium, snapped off a crisp salute and announced he was reporting for wartime duty.
title: Ohio is belle of the US election ball (AFP)
description: AFP - Packing a comely 20 electoral college ballots and offering a flirtatious swing of its polarised vote, the state of Ohio is driving Republicans and Democrats to distraction in this year's US presidential election.
title: Post-Convention Polls Mixed on Kerry Bounce (Reuters)
description: Reuters - New polls gave a mixed picture on\whether Democratic presidential nominee Sen. John Kerry got a\"bounce" from the party's convention, and a CNN-USA Today\Gallup poll on Sunday even showed the Democratic ticket\trailing the Republicans' among likely voters.
title: Dazed Floridians Cope After 'Hell of a Storm'
description: PUNTA GORDA, Fla. (Reuters) - Carolyn Kauffman burst into tears as she got out of her car and saw that Hurricane Charley had reduced her home to a pile of rubble.
title: Hurricane, Tropical Storm Form in Atlantic
description: MIAMI (Reuters) - While Florida tallied the devastation from Hurricane Charley, another hurricane and a tropical storm gathered strength in the Atlantic Ocean on Saturday.
title: U.S. to Pull 70,000 Troops from Europe, Asia
description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The United States plans to withdraw about 70,000 troops from Europe and Asia in a major realignment of American military presence prompted by the end of the Cold War and the beginning of the war on terrorism, U.S. officials said on Saturday.
title: Bush to Visit Hurricane-Damaged Florida
description: SIOUX CITY, Iowa (Reuters) - President Bush wrapped up a five-day campaign swing with a rally in the battleground state of Iowa on Saturday and scheduled a quick trip to Florida to survey hurricane damage in a state he needs to win in the November election.
title: Kerry Asks Campaign Workers to Help Charley Victims
description: HOOD RIVER, Ore. (Reuters) - Democrat John Kerry on Saturday asked his presidential campaign workers in Florida to help in recovery efforts after Hurricane Charley, but said he had no immediate plans to visit the devastated communities.
title: One Fla. County Says Charley Did \$3 Billion Damage
description: MIAMI (Reuters) - Hurricane Charley battered multimillion-dollar houses on exclusive islands off southwest Florida, prompting an initial damage estimate of \$3 billion in one county alone, an official said on Saturday.
title: Troops Patrol Florida After Storm Kills 13
description: PUNTA GORDA, Fla. (Reuters) - National Guard troops in Humvees patrolled devastated southwest Florida to prevent looting on Saturday as rescuers searched for victims of Hurricane Charley which killed at least 13 people, shredded mobile homes and damaged thousands of buildings.
title: 'Passion' Confessor Sentenced to 75 Yrs for Murder
description: HOUSTON (Reuters) - A Texas man who confessed to murder after seeing Mel Gibson's "The Passion of the Christ" was sentenced to 75 years in prison on Friday night for strangling his girlfriend to death.
title: Cuisine Queen Julia Child Dies at 91
description: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Julia Child, the grande dame of U.S. television cooking shows whose operatic voice and irreverent attitude brought French haute cuisine into America's humble kitchens, died in her sleep at her California home on Friday at the age of 91.
title: NASA Identifies Foam Flaw That Killed Astronauts
description: NEW ORLEANS (Reuters) - The foam that struck the space shuttle Columbia after liftoff and led to the deaths of all seven astronauts on board was defective, NASA said on Friday.
title: Charley Leaves at Least 13 Dead
description: Hurricane Charley raced up the Atlantic seaboard, leaving a trail of demolished homes and forcing thousands to evacuate.
title: Sex Scandal Rocks Montana Town
description: Businessman alleged to have paid more than \$1 million over the past decade to have sex with a large number of young women.
title: Storm Prediction Improved but Not Perfect
description: Hurricane Charley's sudden increase in intensity and unexpected path show how difficult it remains for scientists to predict massive storms.
title: Campaigns spar on war leadership
description: Bush and Kerry turn up heat on who's fitter as commander in chief.
title: In war on terror, an expanding citizens' brigade
description: Average Americans, from truck drivers to handymen, are increasingly standing sentry.
title: Stabilizing the global 'greenhouse' may not be so hard
description: Today's tools could cap emissions that contribute to global warming, study finds.
title: ABCs of the CIA: a to-do list for Porter Goss
description: Three former CIA heads give advice on how to run the agency, navigate Washington politics, and stay neutral.
title: Scrap the tax code? Bush floats a national sales tax
description: On the campaign trail, the president appears open to a major shift, which Kerry promptly pans.
